text:
I was building the latest Jelly package directly out of CVS and received this message:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
"Ant could not find the task or a class this task relies upon.

This is common and has a number of causes; the usual 
solutions are to read the manual pages then download and
install needed JAR files, or fix the build file: 
 - You have misspelt 'junit'.
   Fix: check your spelling."

Now, the funny thing about this, and the error, is the fact the "MISSPELT" is not even a word.
So, the irony of "Check your spelling" is quite humorous.
creator: bmichael@goldparrot.com

text: According to the Cambridge Advanced Learners Dictionary misspelt is an English word.
creator: jkf@apache.org
jkf@apache.org
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 26318 ***
